  • City: SOUTHINGTON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The forklift operator elevated his forks too high while entering the pallet and punctured the bottom of the pail. The spill was immediately responded to by hazwoper personnel. The damaged pail was placed into an overpack container. All spilled material and clean up materials were placed into a separate overpack container in preparation for disposition

item.title: Report E-2025070088
item.description:
Report E-2025070088

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-27
  • City: MERIDEN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 27, 2025, two (2) 50-gallon drums of UN1993 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Serivces, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the site. ESI personnel placed both leaking drums into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks. The crew deployed a degreasing agent to the impacted area and placed granular absorbents on top. Hand tools were utilized to retrieve all loose absorbents and placed them into three (3) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025060404
item.description:
Report E-2025060404

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7438
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâs arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas of trailer floor with the dimensions a 3 ft x 3 ft and 1 ft x 2 ft and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a puncture in one (1) poly tote. Clean Harbors performed a tote transfer to one (1) 275-gallon poly tote and two (2) 55-gallon poly drums that was sent on to the customer. The contractor neutralized the trailer floor that was impacted. Clean harbors removed a 4' by 5' area of flooring for repair. They cut up the damaged tote and cage containerizing it into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. Two (2) flex bins with cut up tote and wood were also generated. The waste was staged onsite, and ESTES approved of cleanup activities. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
